												Want to play DMC3? Get this mod: http://www.nexusmods.com/devilmaycry3/mods/1/?It is to DMC3SE what DSfix is to Dark Souls. It fixes the performance, controller and sound issues, making the PC version as solid as its console counterparts. Not only that, the mod has options for on-the-fly style-switching, weapon-switching for all weapons, Doppelganger and Quicksilver styles for Vergil, Air Hike for every weapon, graphical options, etc. DMC3 now has more moves and twice the number of weapons available at a time than DMC4.Devil May Cry 3 is still one of the best action games ever made, and this mod fixes every major issue with the PC port, and elevates the game to even greater heights.Just follow these simple steps1. Install mod2. Follow the instructions.3. CURAYZEEHappy styling.Notes:To make sure the controller works, edit the config .ini file, go to [FIXES], and make sure EnableXInput reads =1To prevent framerate issues, turn off fullscreen in the menu. Then edit the config .ini file, go to [DISPLAY], and change Fullscreen to =1If you have sound or other framerate issues: Edit config .ini file, go to [DEBUG], change DisableBGMEngine to =0 and DisableShadowEngine to =1Other mods that add extra moves and options can be found here:http://www.nexusmods.com/devilmaycry3/?http://s1.zetaboards.com/InfernalWorks/forum/1659736/If you still have controller issues, and installing the StyleSwitcher mod and editing the config file haven't solved your problem, try downloading motioninjoy (http://motioninjoy.en.uptodown.com/) or xpadder.If you haven't found a solution yet, try asking for help here: http://s1.zetaboards.com/InfernalWorks/topic/5834079/1/For anyone using Windows 10 that experiences problems that are not fixed by editing the config file, refer to this guide:


DMC3: SE On Windows 10 - My Guide for the Complete Experience 
A Guide for Devil May Cry 3: Special Edition
By: nealiosis

content:
Posted: January 4, 2015
D - Difficulty - It is well balanced , its little bit hard for the first time but can be beaten with practice , patience , efficient weapon/style uasage and learning enemy moveset  . You need to be extremely good for higher difficulty levels . After all video games need to be challenging , they are more fun that way . DA was tougher than SE .C - Combat - ♥♥♥♥in amazing , its so much fun to hurl enemies into air , use them as a skateboard , mixing devil arms and melee weapons in the combat and beat the♥♥♥♥♥♥out of enemies . Style play  promotes  chaining of combos . Use of different styles , different weapons and devil arms brings variety in combat and gives fresh and fantastic experience . They just nailed it in this department , style switcher mod for pc takes it to next level . There so many brilliant combo videos on youtube and all are  amazing .B - Boss Fights - Boss fights are simply outstanding . Agni&Rudra , Nevan , Beowulf , Dante's shadow , Vergil fights etc ( one of the best boss ever )  all are amazing . No cutscene , qte♥♥♥♥♥♥just pure dope gameplay . You have to learn their moves and fight effectively . Bosses are designed well too and give  sense of achievement after beating them . Normal enemies are not that great and not that bad and there is a room for improvement . Loved vergil's and doppelganger's taunts .A - Action - Right in your face intense action . Amazing combat , style play and hordes of enemies keep the action going on . Few puzzles are here and there which save your fingers from getting sore . DMC3 is all about cool & stylish moves/action . DMC3 is one of the best action games ever made . S- Story - Pretty straightforward story , DMC3 focuses more on action/combat and this what i expect from a action game . Minimal story and loads of gameplay . Cutscenes are top notch and action packed esp. when dante gets devil trigger . Vergil & The Lady cutscenes are equally epic . SS - Sick Soundtrack - Battle theme pumps you up and with metal in the background and action going on the screen , one can never go wrong  . Metal + action games combo  gives birth to amazing gaming experience  . Battle theme do get repetitve and sometimes it gets irritating . Vergil 3 and doppelganger themes are great . Last but not the least , just listen to Devils never cry . So ♥♥♥♥in gooooood SSS - SonS of Sparda - Both Dante and vergil are fantstic characters , esp. Dante . Their chemistry is so interesting , both are twins but completely opposite to each other and whenever they interact its fun watch them . Dante is such a badass character with bring it on attitude and vergil on the other hand calm and more  deadly foe .Their design is pretty great too with old school red vs blue touch . No words to describe the battles between them , play it and experience it . Unarguably one of the best combination and boss fight . Rarely you have a opponent who is equally as powerful as you and defeats you . Being your own brother makes things more heated up( only in game :P )Pc port is bad but can be fixed easliy with few fixes , thanks to modding community . Replay value  is great with playable vergil ,  bloody palce mode and ofcourse trying different styles and maximizing them .Masterpiece 9.9/10

content:
Posted: December 27, 2013
												Most of the negative reviews here are because of technical issues that are solvable on most systems. Fullscreen works by pressing ALT+Enter (maybe not while in the menu or title screen or cutscene, but ingame), widescreen support is available via a hack. On some systems, the resolution may be limited to 640x480 or 800x600, but that is not the normal behaviour. You should get the highest 4:3 resolution closest to your native resolution without a patch. XBox controllers are not officially supported because this game uses directinput for controller support, which is the predecessor to xinput. If you have one of the recent Logitech gamepads (F310 for example), you can choose between directinput and xinput via a hardware switch on the controller, then map the controller keys correctly (setup controller) and the game works out of the box. If you have to use an xbox compatible controller, you have to fiddle around to get the trigger keys working. This is because the trigger keys are analog and on the same axis on the xbox compatible controllers, but are two seperate digital keys on the older standard. Please note that this game was developed before the xbox compatible controllers had been invented! It would have been nice of Capcom to have this version revamped like they did for PS3 and XBox, but they have not.  It is not optimized for the PC and it is an old game, but I still think it is awesome.

content:
Posted: August 11, 2013
												This is the third installment in the Devil May Cry® series, but, in lore, the first one.You take the role of the hero in the previous games, Dante. You get to learn more of his past, how his Devil Hunting store came to be and you get to learn more about his brother, Vergil.It's an old game, but still, one of the best Devil May Cries out there, and one of the most fun! You've got several modes of difficulty in this game, some of those being seriously ridiculous and fun.Being it a Hack and Slash, you can't defend. Only dodge. The more you diverse your attacks and taunt your enemy, the more style points you get, to escalate from D (Dope) to SSS (SSStylish). So do levels rank to that based on your performance throughout them.Although, if you get this game, I advise, GET A CONTROLLER and the software Xpadder. Otherwise, this is going to be a major pain to play without. It was made to bear one, it's meant to be played that way.In short, great game, definitly worth getting!

content:
Posted: December 31, 2016
												Jesus Christ where to start. The Good:- My god, the gameplay, the gameplay is perhaps one of the best hack and slash experiences EVER. Tear through endless demon hordes as Dante, the cool protagonist of the series. (EXCEPT DMC4) - Difficulty is just right, across all modes you get what you asked for. Although some newcomers may have a hard time trying to beat the harder difficulties like Dante Must Die. - The level of replay ability for such a game is great. Even after you beat every difficulty mode as Dante and Vergil (Two different campaigns) you can still fight huge and dangerous groups of demons in Bloody Palace. The Bad: - Some parts of the game are not so fun, which will make you wanna stop playing and take a break. Puzzles that are very horrid will show up, although once you get through them you'll have a good time fighting bosses and enemies. - The story, I will admit I'm attached to the cast and the story yet looking at it professionally it's not the best. Most players will ignore the story and focus on gameplay which is fine, as you won't be missing that much unless you care for the series. - Your boyfriend/girlfriend will leave you after she finds out you spent a week playing this game and not responding to his/her texts. The Ugly(Oh god the ugly):- DEAR GOD, THE PORT OF THIS GAME IS SO ATROCIOUS. Exhibit A: For most folks this game does not work AT ALL. Exhibit B: For all folks, Xbox controllers are not supported. Exhibit C: WHY CAPCOM but wait, there is a fix Yes, some saint that goes by the name of serpentiem has fixed all these problems with Style Switcher. A mod that not only lets you chose styles in the middle of combat, but also repairs the busted PC port that is this game. http://www.nexusmods.com/devilmaycry3/mods/1/?- The graphics have not aged well; this is not the kind of game you can expect to look good although the graphics have that PS2 feel to them. I had a lot more to this review but Steam has a pretty strict character limit so, this is the end of the review. Although here is the original review in case this one wasn't good enough:http://pastebin.com/TGcuRQ0y

content:
Posted: November 25, 2016
												How to make this party Cuhrayzy: The Step-by-step guide1. Buy the game, install 2. Google for DMC3SE style switcher mod3. Follow given instructions4. Lauch the game5. Show your MotivationOptional step: Mess around with mod settings for desired level of Cuhrayzy.While the mod might cause crashes or other problems, I personally can recommend this game only with it, for it makes the PC-version clearly superior version compared to original, emulated or HD-remake. Easily the best starting point for this series, story and gameplay-wise, for DMC1 & 2 struggled to find the thing DMC3 finally brought us: Stylish and fast combat, with different combinations of styles and weapons to find and enemies to beat. The main point is combat, which has level of depth rarely seen: Chance to newer players to learn, challenge for those wanting to best Temen-Ni-Gru and ultimate challenge of mastering the combat to ascend to Realm of Super Smokin' Style. I've played this game semi-regurlarly for almost nine years , starigt with the PS2 version, and still finding new stuff to try. That might be a hit-or-miss for some people, since everything else is made to set stage for ever-increasing showcase of crazy combat: The Story, the music, the levels. Two of the latter are not bad and with mods it is possible to put your own soundfiles (or just mute the music and listen some other music). Story is there, if you want life-like characters, good narrative and thought-provoking themes, go read a book. Here you find classical Capcomesque anime-style story about young, superhuman demonhunter who is most likely blowing his pay-check on pizza and energy drinks. So if you want to clash with the forces of Demon Realm with Style, get the game, apply the mods and get on the ride to experience a piece of best Third Person Action made by Capcom and in my opinion, the history of action games.PS. While mod helps with keyboard & mouse controls, i personally recommend to play with a gamepad.

												Devil May Cry 3 is absolutely CUHRAYZEE.+ Undisputed god-tier gameplay that's fun as all hell with the highest skill ceiling in gaming because it has so much depth and exploitation that you can basically become a god.+ Loads of weapons and styles that offer unlimited gameplay potential.+ The style meter that keeps track and judges your combat performance and how often you switch your attacks up.+ Powerups that you aren't forced to rely on and are even frowned upon since they detract from your ending mission rank.+ Fantastic boss fights at the end of almost every single mission.+ Fantastic level design that manages to be more than linear corridors.+ Metal as f*ck music that perfectly pumps the moment.+ Likable characters all around with cheesy but fantastic voice acting.+ Goofy but charming cutscenes that are absolutely cuhrayzee.- Like two bosses out of the entire game manage to be lackluster.- Some styles will be more useful than others and you may end up relying on just one or two the entire game.You must know that the PC port is absolutely garbage and you will NEED to download the "StyleSwitcher" mod from Nexus to get this game to run properly. It's so bad that the f*cking music files of all things make the game drop frames slightly, even with the mod. If you wish to play this game in an optimal way, buy the DMC HD Collection for either PS3 or Xbox 360 which looks and runs perfectly at 60fps and comes with DMC1, 2, and 3, all great games (except 2..).The game itself is a 9/10. Play it any way you can but be warned the PC version requires work and some sacrifices like turning off some sound and music files.

content:
Posted: February 16, 2015
												before you read my review or buy the game remember DMC3 is a amazing game I highly suggest you buy it, I have bought it three times now but DON'T buy the pc version if you don't want to tear your hair out in frustration but more of that later.Lets start the actual review now shall we?First the story - The story takes place a few years before the first devil may cry, Dante who has yet to pick a name for his shop is just hanging around when a man named Arkham enters and tells Dante his brother has a invitation for him. Dante is then attacked by lessor demons but quickly (and stylishly) kills them all and this starts the events of the game and overall the story is pretty good best in the series has some insane motioncapture and good voice acting (compared to DMC1 and DmC this is oscar worthy)Second the styles - You can choose between four different styles which are Swordmaster where your melee weapons have more moves, do more damage and let you combo in the air easily, Gunslinger lets you use your guns in extremely stylish ways from spinning in mid air while fireing down to curb stomping a demon while shooting him in the head and its a pleasure to watch the animations, Royalguard works as a block button but it doesn't stop there sure you can block and take reduced damage but if you perfectly time your block you can absorb all damage and release it in a extremely damaging attack that if you build enough damage up you can instant kill some of the tougher demons, Trickster gives you another type of dodge, a teleport, a air dash and the ability to run on walls, Trickster can be used to create insane combos if you know what you're doing. There are two other styles quicksilver and doppleganger which let you slow down time and create a copy of yourself and thats about it but if used right are deadly (doppleganger unlocks a hidden two player mode to)Third the combat - The combat in this game is insanely fun with a total of 5 devil arms (melee weapons) and 5 fire arms (guns) for Dante and the ability to bring any combination of weapons (two devil arms two fire arms) and one of 6 styles to choose from this game has a crazy ammount of depth in its combat especailly since all weapons and styles (except doppleganger and quicksilver) can be upgraded and gain more moves.Fourth Extras - With the special edition you are able to play as Vergil who has 3 devil arms and no fire arms but shoots summond swords instead and a single style (he has less depth then Dante but is fun to play) After you beat the game once you can start a new game as Vergil you will be given a cutscene that takes place before DMC3 but don't get your hopes up he ends up going through the same levels as Dante (from the Devil May Cry all the way to hell) The style switcher mod does work on Vergil but you can only use dark slayer (Default style) and Dante's quicksilver style (due to the other styles not working right or them already being a part of Dark Slayer)Fifth should you buy it - In short yes you should buy this game...... if you have a playstation 2 the pc version is a extremely bad port and it is fixable (I fixed it after spending over 10 hours configureing it) it just takes a lot of time and a lot of reading user guides on how to fix it. On the brightside of the pc version is the ability to mod and the famous style switcher mod (go get it now) which lets you change to any of the 6 styles at any time in game without having to stop at a statue to change them (it also comes with other features that let you customize the game further but I won't get into that)If you use a controller be prepared to break it in half with your teeth out of pure rage when you find out the triggers don't work and the sticks are reversed (right stick moves you left stick turns camera) there are fixes for this but they don't always work and if you are useing Motioninjoy be prepared to just quit (I made a discussion post on how to fix a ps3 controller with motioninjoy but if you are useing any other controllers good luck to you)I also hope you have a somewhat decent computer cause this game runs like hell the framerate is subpar and requires you to delete audio files (really?) to get the framerate up but it stops the badass soundtrack from playing if you do so (luckly for me my computer can handle it)Final - Do i recommend this game? again yes if you can get a console copy or if you are willing to spend 10+ hours fixing it, if you have no choice but to buy it on PC buy it when it goes on sale it usualy drops down to $7.50 but this is one of my favorite games of all time it just has a bad pc portLet's Rock!

												Capcom. Wtf man? Ok - without checking forums (and I should never have to do that) it won't run in anything other than ♥♥♥♥♥♥ windowed mode. It's not designed to, or adapted to, 360 compatible joysticks which is pretty much the only stick anyone has. Sure you can reconfigure the joystick but you'll have to remember  what the hell button 4 or 7 or 2 is, and there's no guide or helpful hint so you're just left stabbing in the dark. The only way to get the game working properly (and i'm not sure that I can) is going to be if i go and check forum posts - that just shoudn't happen. It should work perfectly out of the box for the vast majority of setups. They haven't even tried. I should have known after the Ducktales affair (where Capcom released a game that they KNEW was fundamentally broken) that Capcom were going to butt♥♥♥♥ me on this one but like a fool I thought it couldn't be THAT bad. Boy was I wrong. Buy it if you want an example of how ♥♥♥♥♥♥ and lazy a port can be. content:
Posted: July 22, 2016
												If you come here expecting a 4K experience, you came to the wrong place. Maximum you'll get from the game is 1400x1050, which can be enhanced with mods, but I haven't dwelt on those. What I did was use the Windowed Borderless Gaming software to upscale it to 1920x1080. This is a straight up port from the PS2 version of the game. So much so, that you need to either Alt+F4 out of it or boot up Task Manager to terminate the .exe. Another gripe you might have with this game is the control scheme. Again taken straight from the PS2 game, so if you plug a Dualshock 3 controller to your computer with no modification to it's drivers, it will work perfectly. However, you won't be able to use that controller for any other games in it's current state as it isn't recognized as an X-Input controller, which is what other games ask for. Nevertheless, there are tutorials out there in the forums to help you out in configuring your controller so that it works perfectly without too much hassle when switching between games. Now, once you do get your controller running decently with the game I can guarantee one single thing; absolute fun. Being the straight port it is from the PS2 game, the mechanics are exactly the same and they're so intuitive you'll only need a couple of tries till you get the hang of the moves to then execute them to great effect. However, while the skill floor is reasonably low, the skill ceiling is super high. To master the game you WILL have to pour a lot of time and effort into it. Therefore, it boils down to the following: If you want to complete the story, you'll be able to do it without having to practice for hours. It's very accessible for that.If you want to complete every difficulty and unlock everything, get ready to climb those Rocky stairs over and over again. You'll need to learn how to perform every combo consistently, every enemy moveset and understand every mechanic thoroughly, as there is a mode where you die in 1 hit.In conclusion, if you don't mind going through the hassle of solving the issues I pointed out, then;This party is just getting started!- Dante

content:
Posted: February 25, 2016
												As a huge Devil May Cry fan, this game hold up the standards just as well as it's predecessors,possibly even better (I'm looking at you DMC2).From a general game perspective, it is a solid Hack and Slash game with memorable characters,a simple but enjoyable story, and more importantly you get to beat the crap out of demons while being a totalbadass. (Also it's pretty challenging so, if you don't like handholding- this is the game for you)I've had and played this game for about 4 years now, and still love it dearly. (Although it only says 30 hours on Steam, I also played it a lot on PS3 later).But recently I came to notice how low the Steam ratings for this game were, and I read through the reviews to see why.From what I've seen, it's all in regards to the port itself, which is understandable.I've personally never had a problem running the game on Steam (even without downloading patches or anything).That said, I do think that the in-game references to the controls are complete jank, because they are based on anumbering system for buttons that VERY unclear. This can be solved by a simple google search to see what each buttondoes. I don't think the frame-rate is optimal (especially for a hack and slash) but it's not unplayable,I really didn't notice it all that much when I first got into the game, but only after I'd had my share of a varietyof hack and slash games and really came to know the genre, did I notice the difference.I also never had a problem using a controller as the controller scheme menu is actually pretty easy to understand,although customization is a bit annoying.In summary:I guess from my experience, I'd say the game is still worth is, especially during Steam Sales, assuming that you can run it.Like I said, it is a bit jank here and there, and it's not an excellent port by any means, but if you are looking to have a hack and slash game that's easy to run on most computers just to casually play whenever, this is the game for you.

Posted: November 27, 2013
												This i an AMAZING game that I played years ago on the PS2.  Everything about this game is rediculous.  The combat, the story, the cutscenes, it's all over the top crazy action, and I love it.  I bought this on Steam to try to replay it with some better graphics, but unfortunately, this game was not optimized for PC at ALL.Controller support is awful, you CAN get some of them to work, but it isn't easy, and you have to a lot of research to find out how to get it to work.  Graphics are technically better than they were on the PS2, but widescreen support is not built in, so if you are one of the normal PC users that have a 16:9 or 16:10 screen, you will have blackbars on the sides of the screen.  There is a mod to 'fix' this, but it basically just stretches the screen, so it looks awful.Capcom didn't try very hard on the PC version of this game, which is unfortunate, because it's one of the best DMC's.  Try Devil May Cry 4 or DMC, they have way better support, so they know how to do it right, just not wortgh their effort to fix this version I guess. TL;DR version - Great game, but badly ported.  Play the game, just not the PC version.

												I'm sure other reviews here will say roughly the same as I'll say.This is a rather poorly made port of DMC3 for the PS2. It's not entirely unplayable as some may lead you to believe, but it's bad enough to make you want to not play the game despite how fun it is.Most console controllers will refuse to work for the game and what DOES work will leave you wanting more, such as not being able to use one of your joysticks. The real problem comes from the fact that you will have massive, and I mean MASSIVE fps drops in multiple locations resulting in it being neigh unplayable.But in those non-large areas where fps is stable and you fix the controller up, it works rather well for a port.I wouldn't recommend it because it's far too much work to get everything in working condition.(At this point there might even be a fix for the FPS drops but I didn't care to look for it)THAT ALL BEING SAIDIf you don't have a problem with everything I said, feel free to pick up this game.

content:
Posted: October 6, 2016
												You REALLY need to want to play this game if you want to fix everything in this terrible port. You need to download the style switcher mod and/wide-screen mod (and delete some songs out of the soundtrack) to make it playable at least. With the style switcher mod you can have 1080p/60fps gameplay galore but be warned it can become a hassle to install. Now to the game.This is still to this day the king of the character action/spectacle brawler genre. The trifecta would go as dmc3, bayonetta and Ninja Gaiden Black. To this day no other action game has the complexity and freedom that this game provides in its more or less 20 missions. This is no "dial-a-combo" action game, you're free to create your own combos as you wish, just remember that with that freedom comes the weight of complexity as it is no easy game. The skill ceiling goes through the roof, just look at any MAD combo on YouTube. The good thing is that this game is constantly challenging and if you're willing to put the work it will grow with you abilities. There's a lot of difficulty modes which you unlock by beating the game in the difficulty that comes before it and with each new difficulty comes new challenges, a more aggressive AI and even a mode where you cannot get hit. Seriously...this amount of depth has not yet been rivaled by any game in the genre. TL;DR : if you like action games, tough bosses, depth in your combat mechanics, freedom to play as you want, a difficulty that has a pretty high ceiling but eases you up into it this is the game for you. Be aware that you have to be willing to pull off the mods to make it work correctly and also be aware that this game asks a lot from you as s gamer. If you're up to the challenge and you're willing to put in the time this is s sure recommendation. Just like crossfit or a pretty long book, this isn't for everybody but if you're up for the challenge I assure you you'll love it.

content:
Posted: December 13, 2016
Devil May Cry® 3 Special Edition ReviewOne of the best hack'n'slash games ever made, is available on Steam with worst PC port i have ever played.PC portThis is without a doubt, the worst PC port i have ever played. Controlls are terrible, sticks are inverted (left stick controlls the camera, right one controlls the movement), framerate is awful, and graphics are downgraded. What the hell Capcom!? But..... thankfully Style Switcher mod exists. It fixed resolution, controlls and graphics can look bit better. However it didn't fix framerate for me, so i had to delete some songs from the game in order to make it stable, which is just bad. StoryDevil May Cry 3 is a prequel to the original Devil May Cry (which totally deserves to be on Steam...). One day, while young Dante was minding his own business in his shop which he hadn't opened yet, a misterious menacing man called Arkham appeared, and gave Dante an ''invitation'' from his brother Vergil. Vergil thirsts for poweri suppose because he was unable to save his mother and protect his son Nero, and he wants to obtain the strenght of his father Sparda. But in order to do so, he must sacrifice humanity, and that's when Dante is going to try to stop him. In the mean-time, a young lady called Mary (see what i did there?) wants to avenge her mother, by killing the one responsible for her death. The one and only, Arkham. Dante and Mary will occasionally meet each other, and as expected, they will start from hating each other to having huge respect for each other. And now, without saying what will happen, a war between good and evil begins!Cutscenes are awesome, and i rarely skip them. Story is nothing too special, but it's quite amusing.GameplayThis is one of the best hack'n'slash of all time. There are many weapons, items, enemies, and of course, huge difficulty. Is it unfair? No, it's totally fair, and if you died, then it's your fault for not being good enough. Should you feel bad if you die? No, because this game can be ridiculously difficult at moments, but practice makes perfect! Now, there are 2 playable characters:Dante: Haves 6 styles, 5 weapons, 5 firearms. Trickster Style is for those who prefer to have an ''escape'' and ''approach'' ability, which makes it great for evading attacks from enemies and going towards them. Swordsmaster Style is for those who want to go full berserk on demons. Gunslinger Style is for those who prefer more firepower over slashing. Royal Guard is for those who grew up with SF3 and want to parry everything. Quicksilver Style is for those who want to have ''NOW FREEZE!'' button, which usually means your enemy is defenseless, or you're getting pressured. Doppleganger Style is for those who want to.... well honestly i don't know much about this one, let's just say for Naruto fans, because of clones..... Now, if you have Style Switcher mode installed, you can be all of the above at once! As for weapons and firearms, the combo possibilities are endless, so you won't get bored easily.Vergil: Haves 1 style, 3 weapons, 1 firearm. Dark Slayer Style is perfect for evading, approaching, and trolling your opponents. It's so fast, and it works just like you want it to. His main sword Yamato doesn't have many combos, but Judgement Cut ability is ridiculously broken. Beowulf and Infinite Edge are great too, but not as much. His ''firearm'' is basically summoning swords which can fly at your enemies and spin around you for area damage. Best thing is that they  won't stop your attack animation, which means you can spam it as much as you want while beating hell out of demons.All in all, gameplay is fantastic.GraphicsI loved the PS2 graphics, so why the hell are there so many missing details and filters in PC version? It looks washed out. Thankfully, Style Switcher mod haves an option to make graphics slightly closer to PS2 version, but it's still not good.SoundtrackSoundtrack is very atmospheric, and it makes you feel like a badass demon slayer. Genre? I..... suppose electronic rock/metal, i don't really knowOverallOne of my favorite games of all time, with worst PC port in existence. Installing Style Switcher mode can be a pain in the a*s, and after that, you have to set up your controlls and other stuff. Again, this didn't fix horrible framerate for me, so i was forced to play this game without music. IF YOU'RE A DIEHARD, THEN BUY IT ON SALE, IF YOU'RE A NEWCOMER, DON'T BOTHER AND BUY DMC 4: SE OR DMC HD COLLECTION INSTEAD!Devil May Cry 3: 9.5/10PC version: 2/10 but 7/10 with Style SwitcherP.S. Where's my HD Collection on Steam Capcom?

												This game was obviously not optimized for PCs in mind. When I started playing it, it was stuck in 640 x 480 resolution with no way to change resolution or to change to fullscreen despite an option for the former in the options menu. What gives? Also, there was no xinput mappings, so my XBox One controller mappings were all over the place; in fact, to move, I had to move the RIGHT analog stick! It made the game extremely unfun and unplayable. Stay away at all costs until or unless these issues are resolved.

content:
Posted: June 30, 2016
												A great game if you want a game that challenges you and lets you fight with style! Challenging but entertaining fights, a combat system that is fun to explore, and an amusing protagonist to join the ride. It's a bit tricky in the beginning, and you may need some time to get into the mechanics, but it feels very good and rewarding once you get going. At the end of levels you can get ranked from D to S on various things, so there's a lot of room to practice your skills. A less good part of the game would be a bit dodgy platforming in some parts, but they are generally far and between. Oh, and this is not a very good port on it's own. If you want to buy this, remember to download the mod that fixes it up as well!I loved this game, and if you like Platinum style games you may enjoy it too!

content:
Posted: December 20, 2013
												Well, this is awkward.In case you live under a rock, Devil May Cry 3 is an excellent game, and the Special Edition is a gem among spectacle fighters. However, this port is completely unacceptable. Japanese video game companies aren't exactly known for great first attempts at PC porting, and Capcom is no exception. They DID more than make up for it with DMC4 and DmC, with the PC ports being the superior versions of the game, but this is one I can't whole-heartedly recommend. If you picked up the DmC Complete Pack, you basically got this one for free, but since that bundle no longer seems to exist, I can't recommend this, especially not as a single purchase. Unless you're one of the PC Master Race and refuse to own even what is possibly the best console of all time, drop by a GameStop and pick this game up from a used games bin, for a better experience and a much more reasonable asking price. The Steam version of DMC3:SE should only be an absolute last resort.

												Everyone complains about how bad of a PC port it is. Yes, there's no denying that, but it's not THAT bad of a PC port. Sure, it takes a while to get the mandatory controller set up, the frames drop quite a bit, it can't go fullscreen, etc., but it's still a good game. Forget about how bad of a PC port it is, and concentrate on the game itself. It's awesome. Super fun hack-and-slash. This game is VERY difficult, If you're new to DMC, this game will take you out back, strip you of your clothes,♥♥♥♥♥♥you, cut of your manly/womanly parts, keep them as a trophy, and then it will cannibalize your corpse. If you aren't new to DMC, this game will take you out back, dry-hump you, and then only cut off your left nipple. What I'm saying is that it's hard no matter what.

content:
Posted: March 31, 2014
												Devil May Cry 3... the king of the hack and slash games and arguably the prime of the series for its insane yet fun difficulty and its skill based gameplay. Unfortunately however this port to the PC is an insult to this legendary game from its god awful controller layout where community members have to manually add their own layout fixes to this lazy port and along with that at  times crappy frame rate issues have occured regardless of how powerful my pc is. For those new to the series PLEASE do not buy this port! I highly recommened instead buying it either for the PS2 or the HD collection for the XBOX 360/PS3 to see how amazing this game really is.EDIT 16/01/15: A mod called "style switcher" for this PC port has literally fixed almost every issue completely, it makes the game look 10 times better with fog and gamma fixes, fixing the terrible controller button layout, 1080p support (making it sharper and more crisp than the HD collections DMC 3) and widescreen, even allowing you to switch styles with both Dante and Vergil just like in Devil May Cry 4!!! Unfortunately however the framerate issue still applies, but this can be fixed by removing a select amount of audio files (but that means less badassery during combat :c).If you ever (though i'd still not recommend this crappy port) decide to get this PC port please mod it with the style switcher mod!

content:
Posted: December 21, 2013
												Does not work properly. No native controller support, you have to use 3rd party software to make it work, not to mention messing around with the game's ini file to set the controllers right. No native support for modern wide-screens, you have to download a 3rd party patch for that as well. I have also read about issues where the game's fps drops dramatically, where your only solution is deleting a significant number of sound files. Sadly, I never got to see those fps issues.I started the game, it looked like crap, the sound was off, and my Sabertooth was not detected at all.Not to say the computer didn't detect it, I had no problem using Steam's 'Big Picture', but, the game simply refuses to work with it.I tried to use solutions from the forum, sadly, I lack knowladge in controllers and thus it is a bit complicated for me. Amongs things I could not understand, is the fact that ControlMK did not show me which key was which, and those that know Sabertooth, know that it has, in it's full configuration, 16 keys, not including the two analog sticks, and the 4 directional buttons on the left lower side.Left with not enough guidance, and no background knowladge of my own, I am forced to give this game up.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 25, 2013
												Let's have a look on one of Capcons most action loaded games Devil May Cry 3 : Dantes Awakening Special Edition for the PC.Platform: PCPublisher: UbisoftDeveloper: CapcomGenre: Fantasy Action AdventureRelease Date: Oct 16, 2006Story: The story so far plays earlier than the orginal Devil May Cry game for the PS2. Its's about the half devil Dante Sparda who tries once again to save the world from the influence of the devil possesed Arkhamand his horde of undead creatures from hell. In this game there is also some very cool new character introduced named Vergil Sparda who is actually Dantes evil twinbrother and most fearsome foe.Virgil works together with Arkham in order to open the gate of hell which was closed long years ago by Dantes father the legandary Devil Knight Sparda. So Dante starts his journey to climb up the unholy tower of evil called "The Temen-Ni-Gru" which is summoned by Arkham in order to connect the human world to the demon world. On his way up he crosses lines with a strange woman called Lady who tries to shoot him on sight.The whereabouts of the Temen-Ni-Gru as well as the identity of lady seem very dark and unclear. What the end offers... i can't tell, just play to find out :D 8/10Gameplay: DMC3-Se is a third perspective fantasy action adventure which combines very fast gameplay with lots of combos and various puzzles throughout the game. The fighting system is devided in "styles" whichDante can switch between Missions and also level them up to perform even greater combos. There are also special obiects called orbs to collect as well as a very great varaety of fire and melee weapons throughout the game. 8/10Controls: This is one of the main problems with the PC version of DMC3-Se because its totally bugged and you need a patch in order to convert the right keyboard comands to some gamepad. 4/10Graphic: This is unfortunately another minus for the PC port as you will see some graphics in ingame arent drawn very correctly as the PS2 version and also some parts of the game seem pretty greyscale due to the direct X output of your PC, nevertheless the FMV movies are really great. 7/10Sound: I have to mention that the sound is absoluty awesome. DMC3-Se brings some very good soundtrack and very nice soundsamples combined with very thrilling metal music. 9/10My Review: First of all I have to say that I have played only the PC version of DMC3-Se hench I am writting this review for the PC version of that great game.The game starts right of in Dantes office with one of the most impressive and action loaded FMV movies I saw so far. After the nice introducing of the control tutorial you are directly thrown into action to kick some demon butts. You will learn very fast the combos and special attacks if you play the first time through this game. Actually you can change between 4 styles called Trickster, Gunslinger, Royal Guard and Swordmaster. As the names describe, each style is bound to some very cool and unique special attack and combos. For example if you like using long range weapons than you can choose Gunslinger for improving your shoot abillities but if you prefer short range you can go along with Swordmaster. All in one I really liked the style system and the idea of combining different styles. So after you have killed tons of demons and alot of other evil guys you will be introduced step by step through very cool FMV movies to the story of this game which is in my opinion really great. The game is divided in 20 Missions, and you will come across some very cool and though bosses, one remarcable of them will be Dantes twinbrother Virgil who actually seems to interfere with Dante on purpose. The boss fights are one big plus in this game because they really deliever some thrilling and decent difficulty (at least if you play on very hard or Dante must die mode). What I really liked about this game is the character developement its really different from DMC2 which was... to put it bluntly "it sucked". I would generally say that the difficulty in this game is fair and really depends on what scale you play. I beat this game on hard mode in 9 hours but some other guys sure need between 15 - 20 hours. Also after beating the entire game you can unlock Vergil as a playable character, and this is included in the Special edition only as well as some other nice feature I will mention beneath.So what are the differences between the original Devil May Cry 3 : Dantes Awakening and Devil May Cry 3 : Dantes Awakening Special Edition you may ask ?Well here they are:Difficulties:- Easy mode- Hard mode - Very Hard mode- Dante Must Die mode- Heaven or Hell modePlayable Character:- "Vergil" is playable after beating the game once with Dante. He brings his own uniqe styles as well as flying swords as his long range weapons.Extra Mode:- "Bloody Palace" is available after beating the game once with Dante, its some kind of battle arena where you are thrown in with a limited supply of orbs and must fight random enemies and bosses.Extra Outfits:- 4 new costumes for Vergil unlockable- 6 new outfits for Dante unlockableGallery:-you can unlock diverse Artwork and CGI work form DMC3 hereDemo Digest:- You can preview all Ingame Movies from here- There is also some timelimit in the end of the game where you can beat 100 enemies in order to unlock a hidden endingMiscellaneous:- There are different locations in the game where you know can fight Jester (its that annoying clown BTW)- Lady wears some fency new suit depending on the outfit you choose in Ingame- There is a yellow and gold option at the beginning of the game which allows to use the yellow orbs as restore point after dieing.These are the differences available in the Special Edition of DMC3 as well for the PS2 version as for the PC version which was only released as the Special edition by the way.FInal Words: DMC3 SE sure is some special game for fans of the Devil May Cry series as well as for action fans who like fast and flashy gamplay combined with metal music and gothic ambience. I was very pleased about the importation of this game to the PC and really forgot fast about the undeveloped control settings which is a pain in the♥♥♥♥♥♥indeed for people who wants to play the PC version on a gamepad. All I can say is that you should stick with the PS2 version if you are a die hard fan of DMC as for me I also liked the PC version therefore I give this game a 7 out of 10.Endrating: 7/10

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 26, 2016
												So Devil May Cry 3 is a game I played a long time ago on the ps2, and I played the original. The original was much harder as the medium difficulty for that game was the hard for this version of the game. Somehow I beat the game and it was fantastic. Sadly this pc port was done by, get a vomit bucket, Ubisoft. As we all know, anything Ubisoft touches usually gets destroyed, and that is exactly what happened to this pc port. The controls don't work, the right stick controls the movement which is impossible to play with, the game has no support for widescreen moniters, it has a max resolution of 1280x720. Now these issues make the game unplayable. However thanks to the amazing mod authors, all of these issues are fixed with 1 simple mod, Style Switcher. Style switcher fixes the game to allow all resolutions, fixes the controls, makes the game compatible with most widescreen moniters, and it even allows the ability to switch styles with the dpad just like dmc4! It requires a few ini tweaks but overall is easy to install. The game itself is fantastic, theres no question about that, but the main reason this game has downvotes is because of the port, which is all fixed with this mod. So if you want to play dmc3, buy this, get the mod, and play one of the hardest, most rewarding, and one of the best games on ps2.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 20, 2014
												As much as I love Devil May Cry 3, the PC version is absolutely unplayable. I've spent hours trying to get this game to run correctly, trying every solution I've found online and nothing has worked. One thing every game needs in order to be played is a proper control system. With the six different programs I've downloaded to run this one game with a Playstation 3 controller, I can finally use my four basic buttons, but having to use the right analog stick to move Dante and the left analog stick to move the camera is torturous. I found myself using the right analog stick with my left thumb just to be able to move around. I understand that this game is old and has never worked right, but if Valve is to sucker people like me out of their money for it 9 years later, I think it's about time it got fixed. I wish I could get my money and all the time invested into trying to get the game to work properly back. If you want to play this game, you're much better off buying the PS2 version, but whatever you do, do NOT buy this horrible PC version.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 9, 2014
												It is difficult to say whether I would recommend this. It is a fun game but with some quite severe issues. I'm not convinced that it is enough fun to outweigh the problems. This is a very shoddy console port with the controller arbitrarily mapped to the keyboard without any thought about how it might play. You can remap them but you can't use the mouse. Eventually with help from the forums I managed to configure enough of the controls to a controller for it to be playable. Once I got the game working the difficulty of this game is horrible and the button combos for special moves terrible. Eventually once you have died a few times it unlocks easy mode. Only at this point does the game become fun. It has an enjoyable story and excellent level design. Dante manages to come across as confidently awesome where it would have been very easy to be arrogant and hateable. So whether you buy this game or not depends upon you think it is worth the rigmarole of getting it up and running.

												I think it says something that even with a terrible port job the gameplay still shines. (this ain't a review of the game, just a bad port warning)There isn't native gamepad support because this is an old PC port. You can still play with a keyboard and you can get a gamepad eventually working. But there is one glaring problem with this port. There is a bug in the sound engine that makes certain noises cause frame rate drops. You can avoid this by deleting sound files.... but it's pretty ludicrous to have to play the game with muted sounds.If there was a way to fix that sound glitch without needing to remove the files then I could recommend it, but as of right now  (and the forseeable future) DO NOT GET THIS PORT. Pick up DmC HD Collection on PS3/360 instead.

number of helpful: 3 of 5 people (60%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 5, 2014
												IMHO its criminal to sell this game in its current state and Steam owes me money. Here are all the problems: no fullscreen, choppy music, terrible/nonexistent keyboard controls (you literally can't navigate the menu w/ a keyboard), and ONLY three crappy resolution options. Oh but we aren't done, there's more to this crapshoot. Once you do get a controller to play this game, you better hope you got a PS3 controller, otherwise you have to manually edit files in the game to get an Xbox 360 controller working--but guess what! This still won't solve the control problems! The camera controls are nearly nonexistent. R3 snaps the camera to Dante's back, sometimes. Terrain/walls/obstacles within a level will stop the camera in its tracks whether you're using R3 or the stick itself (which pans the camera at a snail's pace). In a notoriously difficult game, this is unacceptable since you will be getting attacked offscreen. Yeah, it only cost me a few dollars, but I'd have been better off using my money as fuel for a fire. Do yourself a favor and tell Capcom how unacceptable this is with your wallet by staying far away from this terrible experience.

number of helpful: 3 of 5 people (60%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 20, 2014
												Unless you have a controller that works with this game, do not even attempt it. the default controls for the camera are the arrow keys, and you cannot bind them to the mouse, neither can you bind attacking to the mouse. As of combat, it's 1 button to rule them all, why use anything besides your sword attack, if the only other attack you have is weak guns, only used for maintaining your combo, or your "style" attack, which does barely anything. And for those of you who say, "well this dante is better than the one in DMC", I do not see much difference, except that this dante in fact, does not even care about anything, his emotions feel faked, he's not even a prick, who is like "oh you stepped on my pizza, now I'm mad", but he's like "oh you stepped on my pizza, this party is gonna be good". What kind of response is that?Also, even if you get a controller working, the spaces and invisible walls your camera has to deal with, make an overview of the battlefield impossible. For once, I think an AAA sequel of a game has been better than the old ones.Oh, something popped up in my mind, this game is made for square screen resolutions. You can press alt+enter to enter fullscreen mode, but if your pixels turn rectangly where they should be square, this is not an improvement. So please, for the love of your wallet, do not buy this.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 4, 2014
												Let me get this out of the way. I love Devil May Cry 3: Special Edition. It is a fantastic hack n'slash game that I can recommend to anyone. However, don't get the PC version because of the controller compatibility issues. Any regular controller, like for example a logitech gamepad, the game will say that the controller import is not compatible with the game. The button layout that the game expects you to use as the default control settings is beyond terrible. Now you can map the buttons on the controller for different commands, but the game does not recognize the left and right triggers as buttons. The only way to make your controller sync up with Devil May Cry 3 is to download a program like Xpadder and customize your own default controls setting and then sync that to the game. The thing is you'll have to shell out $10.00 to download Xpadder. So that will be the determining factor if you want to by the game or not. Personally, I'd get any other version of Devil May Cry 3: Special Edition over the PC version.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 8, 2014
												Great game. Undeniably best in the DMC series. However, this port was terrible. The game is locked to 4:3 resolutions despite originally comig from a widescreen ready console, unable to go fullscreen by ANY means (not even F11) and not mappable to an Xbox 360 pad unless one actually manually Assigns such in a text file within the game folders, even then the triggers not working correctly. The game is prone to utterly random lag even on a PC capable of playing 2011 level AAA titles on full settings.Legitimately, if you have a decent PC by 2014 standards, it's actually better to play this game through a PS2 emulator.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 25, 2013
												I've been wanting to play a Devil May Cry game for a really long time, but couldn't because of my religious parents. So when I saw the PC port, I put it on my wishlist because I've only heard good things about DMC and I love Dante's wit and sarcasm.I should have read the reviews first, and then removed it so that my good friends didn't waste their money getting it for me. I can't tell if having a gamepad or a controller would have made any difference or not. I spent the first, probably, 15-20 minutes trying to figure out what keys did what, and then trying to configure them to what could best suit me. But it was futile.This port is beyond unplayable in the state it's in right now, at least for me(I don't know about anyone else). It wouldn't even let me past the "Style Selection" menu because when I'd press 3 to select, it would just move the cursor down the list of fighting styles. I gave up. I'm probably never going to be able to play this game unless Capcom and Steam release an updated, BETTER, port because of the "sensitive" nature of the game. At least I was given 3 and 4, and from what I've read, 4 is at least an okay port. I'm very disappointed in the lack of effort that was clearly put into this release, though.TL;DR: Don't buy the port unless you're good at coding and are willing to dig deep and research how to make this game dance for you. Buy the DMC HD collection instead if you can get the platform for it.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 27, 2013
												I love DmC:3.  I love the Gold edition to play around as Vergil.  I love the music and, despite the games plot always being ridiculous and hammy, this is one of the better plots I could get invested in (though I haven't completed 4 yet so my opinion might change...."might" ).*clears throat* ...with that said; I love the game (on PS2 or PS3).  This port to the steam (currently) is NON-PLAYABLE (unless you PC players are truly experts on playing action games like this on a Keyboard and don't mind wearing out or breaking your keys).  So far, it doesn't matter what Gamepad you are using; I've tried the PC Microsoft Xbox controller and using a gamepad program to make my PS3 and PS2 controller work on my comptuer (and I have made it work for several games without problems INCLUDING some where I had to custom input the functions for each buttons)...but it is STILL UNPLAYABLE.  Most of the functionatlly still works; the sword/gun/jump/camera/taunt/tricks button can still be used properly and rearranged on the game's setup screen like normal,,,but the Analog sticks DO NOT WORK CORRECTLY.That's the only real problem at this time (which is why I can't comment on anything else graphical or compatibile-wise because I'm stuck in level 1).  The left analog stick does NOT function at all for this game.  For some reason you have to move with the right stick; but even if THAT functioned correctly I don't think most players could play this game at all like this.  And it's STILL bad because the only thing you can do to move is either left or right (or just up or down).  Either way; you can NOT move properly to enjoy playing this port.I'm not officially ready to say this Port SUCKS, because I am REALLY hoping Valve/Steam team are getting feedback like this and tell them they need to fix/patch the control schemes if anyone is to ever play this port at all.  Otherwise; for now until they do so, Do NOT purchase this game unless you more of a game collector building up your library.(To note: I have read some of the Steam user's guides to set-up your gamepad controller for it to work properly and said they had success...but I've tried and retried several times and I don't think the Game itself will register it at all, only keeping to what it's currently control functions are...which is crap.  Also, the port does come with a Gamepad Config that will NOT RECOGNIZE the Xbox controller...it recognized my PS controller, but nothing was accomplished as I hoped.  Plus, there is a option to switch/Reverse the L and R analog sticks...but it didn't do anything at all! ).

content:
Posted: September 13, 2014
												UPDATE: It seems the first link and second link for the joystick support in my review died. Look in the DMC3 Guide. Control fix is below in Update 2.UPDATE 2:  MotionInJoy setupIf you have a PS3 controller and MotionInJoy you can play this by choosing a custom profile and assigning:L stick x+ to Ry+L stick x- to Ry-L stick y+ to Rz+L stick y- to Rz-R stick x+ to Slider+R stick x+ to Slider-Do this and you'll have analogue movement and camera rotation!Anyways, I don't believe this is a bad port. If people tried resarching a little more you can get the werid and bad controls corrected.It's a great game overall though, I have it on ps2 but I got it on the PC sense I am not sure where my PS2 DMC3 Copy went off too. It's great to play this game again. But all I can say it's not a bad port, With a little research and mods to the game it will help correct it.

number of helpful: 6 of 13 people (46%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: July 5, 2015
												Many people are saying the port is awful for controllers, but are simply too lazy to look in the discussion page for this game to search for a fix, so I'll ignore that.The keyboard controls for this game can be easily found by going into the options and looking at the controls as well. Not only that, but they work just fine, so ignore the idiots that are too lazy to solve problems and just write an angry review after 10 minutes.About the actual game, the port has some problems with some lag in a few areas. It's not excessive lag that will affect gameplay, but it will slow down the game for a second. One spot I can think of off the top of my head is the area on Mission 7 where you have to jump down to enter the library. I noticed slightly more lag with Vergil, but again, it did not affect areas where I was actually fighting enemies. There are also fixes for the lag if it seems like it's actually affecting your gameplay, so again, if you plan on getting this game, take a couple minutes to look for some common questions and answers. It's a good game and you don't need a console to play it, so there's no point in throwing a hissy-fit when you encounter small problems with the port.

number of helpful: 3 of 7 people (43%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 8, 2016
												I love this game and the series since DMC1 which is the best one in my opinion, a timeless classic no doubt. (DMC2 is not real and never happened for me). And while this is a good game sadly this port is not.This port has many many issues and it can't be fixed even with the Style Switcher Mod, and is a real shame since this could have been the best version ever, the framerate is unstable in many parts and the recommended fix is to delete some music files which I find preposterous to call that a real fix.The game stutters (and no, it's not your computer) the audio system is broken, many of the effects like when you swing the sword around sound a lot worse than the PS2 version and even the music, and I haven't even mention the sound crackling, plus no real controller support and then you need edit a config file to add your pad manually or download 3rd party stuff just to use the triggers to change guns on the fly, which is something I never had to do ever before in my 20 years playing games on PC.Now let's talk about graphics, yes technically with a mod you can play the game at any resolution you want which is a huge advantage over the console versions, but taking into account the bad performance and that the game is missing a lot of visual effects, for example it has no shaders or colour correction, so you lose the original atmosphere of the game, no dynamic shadows just generic blobs, no depth of field or bloom, NO v-sync, weird and worse quality textures compared to the PS2 version., or that the game crashes from time to time, you might start to understand why I hate this port and I don't recommend it, there's even some bugs that are exclusive to the PC version like one that can make you lose thousands of orbs, or that the game can randomly  corrupt your saves. In conclusion this port is bad,  this is not the case where you install 1 or 2 mods and the game runs completely flawlessly. It seems like Nothing can get rid of the framedrops NOTHING who cares if you can run the game at 60fps if in many random parts you will see your framerate drop to 20 or 40 for no reason. I don't know about the others but I'm pretty sensible to stutter and framedrops. And This is not acceptable for a such a good game.I wish Capcom would step up and port the HD collection like their last ports which have been received positively but it's highly unlikely to happen.If you want to play the game, They're other better ways to enjoy this game Like running the original PS2 version on PCSX2 if you know how to configure it or grabbing the HD Collection if you have a PS3/XBOX360 around.

content:
Posted: October 30, 2015
												I do love DMC and have probably clocked well above week's worth of gameplay on the PS2. It really a great action title that's just great for those looking for a challenge, But I cannot reccomend this version if you are not willing to remove files such as the battle music and fiddle with a .ini to get a modern controller working just right with the game. I already have a PS2 copy to play still so I think I'll just live with that. If you do not have a console and insist on playing this game just know there will be a few hoops to jump through to get this game at it's peak and that it may never be quite as great as it is on a console, you can check out it's entry on the PC Gaming wiki to find all the fixes and links to certain mods to make your time easier,And while I don't care for these mods as I wish to play the game vanilla, there does seem to be mods which add to the gameplay such as giving Dante his style switch system from DMC4 that also happens to add a FoV option.

I must say, I feel a very slight sense of regret for never having done it, because this game gave me cancer anyway

Product received for free
												Devil May Cry 3 Special Edition is a fun game, with well developed characters, a great story, challenging puzzles and awesome gameplay and battles. However I did not like this version of the game, pc over XBox 360, due to the difficult controls and movement. I prefer the Devil May Cry HD Collection for the XBox 360 over the PC version simply due to the easier controls, movement, and camera angles. This game also has the issue of starting out with a small screen instead of fullscreen, if you want the fullscreen you have to change the resolution. Now this isn't much of an issue but it is an annoyance that shouldn't even exist. With the HD Collection for the 360, you get the first three DMC games for about $20, instead of spending close to $40 here on Steam for each individual game. If you're looking for a really good hackin' slash, action packed game look no further than DMC 3 SE!

content:
Posted: June 17, 2015
												Should you play DMC3? Yes, indeed, the game is pretty good and has a quite interesting combat. Should you buy this port? Nope. Unless your willing to invest around an hour changing things in order to play the game correctly. Controllers are barely supported. The right and left triggers are not recognized in the game, so you need a program that allows you to configure those triggers to keyboard buttons in order to switch your weapons in game, unless you want to press (Q) or (E) to switch your weapons mid game. tl;dr - Amazing game. Terrible port. Don't buy unless you're willing to spend around an hour to get the game functioning correctly.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 31, 2014
												Fantastic game by absolutely all means, and if not the best game in the entire Devil May Cry franchise.However, considering this is not on it's original platform, the controls can come off as a bit convoluted. It would be nice if the game were ported and configured to be a bit more PC friendly like the franchise's newest addition.But this aside, DMC3 is definitely my all-time favourite game in the series.The controls are solid, the game feel is fluid, and it's just dang fun to play! I couldn't think of a different game from the series I would recommend one plays first than this.And with that, you'd have to play this first. It's only the prequel to events leading up to the rest of the games.Granted DmC Devil May Cry takes the title of complete prequel, Devil May Cry 3 is just the best game in the whole series.

number of helpful: 2 of 5 people (40%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 24, 2014
												This game is a broken port of the console version. Very badly made without thinking from the perspective of the PC player control ergonomics either using keyboard or gamepad.GRAPHICSThe graphics are typical of the older Play Station games (think of Resident Evil 2 and 3, except that background buildings are also in 3D). It's dated for 2015, but nothing sinful from when it was originally released.But the sinful thing in here is that there is no fullscreen mode. It can only be viewed in windowed mode. Max resolution is at 1600x1200. (Even DOS games has fullscreen).SOUNDIt's ok. From the intro to the rock tunes of the (in-game) broken jukebox, it does fine. Positional audio was not used.CONTROLSIt's a bad port mainly because the control scheme is unbearably bad... keyboard or XBox controller.With the keyboard, you can configure the key map. The problem with using the keyboard is that [Jump] is reflected as [Style Action]. Pressing [Style Action] is still [Style Action]. I can't make Dante jump.Buttons can also be configured with the XBox controller... except for the directional movement which is unfortunately placed to the Right analog stick. Forget about no rumble feature. I just want to move the character properly, which I can't.GAMEPLAYIt has a lot of potential and I can feel that this could have been a good game. Camera control poorly done as well, though. I can only reset the camera view to it's default location. I can't do anything else with it.OVERALLI can't even play it, so I can't recommend it at all. The DMC franchise has gone a long way, but unless they've made the controls better, it is probably best to play the older parts of the franchise in the console rather than the PC.

content:
Posted: January 8
												Question time:Did Capcom mess up by making a bad port? - Yes, royally!Did they have a brain fart when they made Devil May Cry: HD Collection only for X360 & PS3? - Yes, but that's just my opinion.Is this game worth buying? - YES! YES! AND F***ING YES!!!BUT:Be ready to spend less than 2 hours (or less than that), just to make it compatible with your controller and to enable Widescreen support. Feel free to work out the Style Switcher mod too. It was the second time I bought this game, because the first time I refunded it and didn't want to deal with the fixes. However, I thought of giving it another shot, so I purchased it while it was on sale and...It's totally worth it in the end! Two things I love about this game: the gameplay and the soundtrack. It makes your blood pump and really feel the action. The story is compelling, even for a game that focuses more on action.You will not regret the time spent on making those fixes. Check out the Steam discussions forums or other forums and you will find your answers right away.

content:
Posted: January 7, 2015
												Probably one of the best hack and slash games I've ever played. While the game is a dreadful PC port, the game is excellent. Everything holds up really well, especially the combat. While the game is old, the combat rivals most modern hack and slash games, it's that good. The story is kind of dumb at first, but gets better as the game progresses. The graphics aren't bad, especially for the time. The soundtrack is an alt-rock/metal type which fits in perfectly with what's going on in the game. If your going to play this game, use a playstation 2,  3, or 4 controller, because playing with a keyboard is impossible and trying to get an xbox controller to work with the game is too much work.Raw Score: 9/10Score with bad port factored in: 7.5/10If you can look past the port issues, you'll love this game.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 1, 2015
												Devil May Cry 3 is probably my favourite action/hack n slash game of all time.  I had the special edition on the ps 2 about 9 years ago, and i loved it like a small angel that fell from heaven.This port, however, is a worthless, broken and disgraceful sham.  If you've got a console, get the Devil May Cry HD edition instead.  If, like me, your a solo pc gamer, there's no way to get the full goodness of this game, even with all the mods.First, the controls are broken.  You can kind of get it to work with mods, but as far as i'm aware you can't get the shoulder buttons (lt and rt) to work, and you actually need them.  I also couldn't get my second analog stick to work the camera, which makes the game most unenjoyable as you can't adjust the camera manually.  I could kind of deal with that, but...The framerate is awful.  This is a 2005 ps2 game which stutters and grinds down to abysmal rates on a PC that easily handles Skyrim.  You can fix it by deleting select audion files, apparantly, but left with the choice of losing audio or tolerating a crappy framerate, i choose to just uninstall it and leave my memories untarnished.If you've got a console, get the HD collection. You might also want to try Devil May Cry 4, which is a much better and all round pretty sweet PC port (though sadly an inferior game),  If you get this on pc, be aware that you are buying a woefully grim port of classic.

												One of the best character action games ever made, with classic Capcom arcade atmosphere, wonderful writing, an action packed soundtrack, and punishing yet rewarding gameplay. number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 5, 2015
												While I am a huge fan of the Devil May Cry series, the simple fact that this version has such lackluster control makes it worth collecting purely for a completionist. The story is still good, and the game itself is as enchanting as the console versions - but the partial controller support is a big pain in the butt. Not to mention all of the mods you would need to download, figure out, and install just to put it on the same level as Devil May Cry 4 in terms of playability. All in all, a great game bogged down by poor redesign and an incomplete transition to modern PCs. If you don't have the patience for mods - and unless someone has the kindness and time to put together everything into one, easy-to-handle package - you're better off with the console versions.

												Stupidest ♥♥♥♥ing game on the planet. First of all. every time you turn on the game, theres a ♥♥♥♥ing movie your not allowed to skip. Secondly, the controls are ♥♥♥♥ed. Then even if you go try to change the controls, your not allowed to switch the two sticks, and you have to take half an hour to decode their labelling system of the ♥♥♥♥ing buttons - instead of using the universally accepted A, B, X, Y, or any of the buttons from any other commonly used controller, their buttons are labelled 1 to 11. And since your not allowed to use the triggers on the controller, theres only 10 buttons on the ♥♥♥♥ing controller, so I don't know what the ♥♥♥♥ button 11 is. Do NOT waste your money on this game unless you intend to somehow play it with a keyboard, in which case my personal opinion is that you're insane.

content:
Posted: September 6, 2016
												So before anything I need to say I played this game on PS2. In my opinion, this is the best Devil May Cry. The difficulty, the story, amazingly stylish gameplay and the most important part of this is Dante. He is so cool and likable, also Vergil is great character and fighting him for me is one of the best fights in the game. BUT!!!!! Like I said I refunded this because I couldn't get it to work (resolution, controller support etc.). But on the other hand, I didn't try hard enough to fix it all. I'm sure IT IS POSSIBLE to get this to work on PC and it's definitely worth going the extra mile for it. So all in all. If you are ready to work around all of these issues with this port and try to fix it BUY IT. If you are like me and can't stand going and fixing stuff you just bought and downloaded DON'T BUY IT. And if you have a PS2 then go and buy DMC 1,2 and 3 for 20$ or something like this and spent your weekend being awesome.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 7, 2016
												This "special edition" is worse than many BETA games on Steam. As soon as I booted up DMC3 the display was warped and distorted on the beginning cutscenes... and the worse part about it is that you can't skip it and have to endure it for a good several minutes each time you boot up the game. Just when you think that's over, the controls are awkward and uncomfortable. It's barely even playable and the guides on Steam couldn't resolve my display and contoler issues. But just when you decide to leave this trash of a port the game doesn't have a real exit function for PC so you're forced to close it with task manager and wait for your computer to respond. Sure, maybe you could be able to get this game to work, but the amount of hassle it takes to enjoy the game really isn't worth it. DMC3 is a really good game, but this is a terrible port of it and you should spare your wallet of this $20 pile of crap.

content:
Posted: July 7, 2016
												This "special edition" is worse than many BETA games on Steam. As soon as I booted up DMC3 the display was warped and distorted on the beginning cutscenes... and the worse part about it is that you can't skip it and have to endure it for a good several minutes each time you boot up the game. Just when you think that's over, the controls are awkward and uncomfortable. It's barely even playable and the guides on Steam couldn't resolve my display and contoler issues. But just when you decide to leave this trash of a port the game doesn't have a real exit function for PC so you're forced to close it with task manager and wait for your computer to respond. Sure, maybe you could be able to get this game to work, but the amount of hassle it takes to enjoy the game really isn't worth it. DMC3 is a really good game, but this is a terrible port of it and you should spare your wallet of this $20 pile of crap.

content:
Posted: January 18, 2013
												DMC3 is one of the best action games ever but somehow Capcom ruined it for the PC and made one of the worst ports possible. This version is a direct 1:1 port of the console version and is impossible to play. I have tried every gamepad config option through both the game's choices and MotioninJoy's emulated controllers and none of them work properly. Either the buttons refuse to map in game, axis' are reversed/swapped, or the controller just isn't reconized. I have a PS3 controller and it works with every other gamepad game I've played before. Yes, keyboard controls are technically possible but ridiculously cumbersome considering the control scheme.Even if my gamepad worked, the game starts off windowed and max rez on my 1920x1080 monitor is 1280x960, with all other options being 4:3 and no widescreen support. All cutscenes are heavily compressed and look significantly worse than the console versions. Actual gameplay looks better but considering that I can't play it kind of ruins the experience.Pick this up on PS2 or use an emu instead because this is unplayable.

												This PC port is utterly broken, it's been broken since the original release. Do NOT buy this crap, it's not playable on PC at all.
